reasoning: Content migration task moving planning documentation from legacy openspec/ folder to new auto-claude task system. Clear source (117 files in openspec/) and target (auto-claude/specs/) with established patterns. 10 active change proposals to convert to new tasks. No external integrations or infrastructure changes required.

scope.notes: Read ~30-50 openspec files (10 active changes with proposals, tasks, specs), create ~10-15 new task specifications in auto-claude system, then cleanup old folder

integrations.notes: Pure documentation/content migration. No external APIs or new libraries involved

infrastructure.notes: No infrastructure changes - just markdown file reorganization

knowledge.notes: Both openspec and auto-claude task formats are markdown-based with clear structure. Patterns visible in existing specs like 001-physics-optimization

concerns: Must preserve all meaningful information before deleting old files
Need to verify new tasks capture all actionable items from old specs
risk.notes: Low risk as this is content migration with backups possible via git. Old files only removed after verification

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Documentation migration with no functional code changes. Validation should verify new tasks are complete and capture all actionable items from old specs before cleanup. Git provides natural backup.
